writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
Every morning, I wake up next to Nico, his dark hair a tangled mess against the pillow, and his eyes still sleepy from the night before. Our mornings are a ritual, a carefully choreographed dance of laughter and kisses, of pushing and shoving to get out of bed, and then collapsing back into each other's arms. It's a battle we've been fighting for years, and one that I'm more than happy to lose.

As I roll over to face him, he's already awake, his eyes fixed on me with a mischievous glint. "Good morning, love," he says, his voice low and husky.

I smile, reaching out to brush a strand of hair out of his face. "Morning, handsome. What's the plan for today?"

Nico shrugs, a lazy movement that makes me laugh. "Depends on you. We could go for a run, or hit the gym, or—"

I interrupt him, my hand trailing down his chest to his stomach. "Or we could stay in bed and see who can stay awake the longest."

Nico's eyes light up, and he reaches out to pull me close. "Game on."

But as we settle into our usual routine, something feels off. Nico's usual enthusiasm is tempered, and he seems...distracted. I try to brush it off, thinking it's just stress from the recent demigod drama, but as the day wears on, I realize that something's really wrong.

It isn't until we're walking back to the cabin after dinner that Nico stops and turns to me, his eyes serious. "Will, can I ask you something?"

My heart skips a beat as I nod, feeling a sense of trepidation. "Anything, love."

Nico takes a deep breath, his voice barely above a whisper. "Do you ever get tired of our routine? Of waking up every morning, and doing the same thing, and going to bed at the same time?"

I'm taken aback, unsure of how to respond. It's not that I don't love our routine – I do. It's what makes me feel safe, what makes me feel like I'm home.

But as I look at Nico, I see the vulnerability in his eyes, and I know that he's not asking out of curiosity. He's asking because he's tired of it too.

I take a deep breath, my heart pounding in my chest. "Nico, I...I don't know what you're asking for."

He smiles, a small, sad smile. "I'm asking if we can try something different. Just for a little while. Something new."

My mind is racing, but one thing is clear: I'll do anything to make Nico happy. "Okay," I say, my voice barely above a whisper. "What did you have in mind?"

Nico's eyes light up, and he takes my hand, leading me off into the unknown.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
Will was holding his phone up to my face, a goofy grin plastered on his cheek. "See, I told you it's no big deal. You can look through my phone anytime."

I raised an eyebrow, still feeling a little skeptical. "You're really okay with that?"

Will chuckled. "Yeah, I'm a very trusting person. I trust you to not judge me for my weird cat videos or my extensive collection of memes."

I rolled my eyes good-naturedly. "That's not what I'm worried about. I just don't want to see any... unpleasantness."

Will's grin turned mischievous. "Unpleasantness? You mean, like, my extensive collection of fanfiction about Camp Half-Blood and the demigod romances?"

I playfully hit him on the arm. "Shut up, that's not funny."

But Will just laughed and handed me his phone. "Fine, look through it. I dare you."

I hesitated for a moment, then started scrolling through Will's phone. At first, it was just the usual stuff – texts from his friends, social media posts, and a bunch of pictures of us together. But then, I started to notice something. There were a bunch of candid photos of me scattered throughout his phone, each one capturing a moment I hadn't even realized was special.

There was the time we were at the beach, and I was building a sandcastle with Annabeth. Will had taken a photo of me from behind, my hair blowing in the wind and a look of concentration on my face. I hadn't even noticed him snapping the picture.

There was the time we were at the camp, and I was helping Rachel with her Latin homework. Will had taken a photo of me from across the table, my eyes focused intently on the textbook and a look of determination on my face.

And then there was the time we were at the library, and I was reading a book on Greek mythology. Will had taken a photo of me from above, my face tilted back and a look of wonder on my face.

Each photo was like a tiny little time capsule, capturing a moment in time that I had forgotten. But as I looked through them, I realized that they weren't just random snapshots. They were moments that Will had chosen to capture, moments that he had deemed special enough to remember.

I looked up at Will, my eyes welling up with tears. "Why did you take these?" I asked, my voice barely above a whisper.

Will's face softened, and he took the phone back from me. "Because," he said, "those moments are special to me. And I wanted to remember them, to hold onto them. You're an amazing person, Nico, and I'm so lucky to have you in my life."

I felt a lump form in my throat as I looked at Will, really looked at him. I saw the love and adoration in his eyes, and I knew that he was telling the truth. Those moments, the ones that Will had captured, were special because they were moments of us, moments of our relationship.

And as I looked at Will, I knew that I wanted to capture those moments too, to hold onto them and remember them forever. I leaned in and kissed him, feeling a sense of gratitude and love that I had never felt before.

"Thank you," I whispered, my lips against his.

Will smiled, his eyes shining with happiness. "Anytime, Nico. Anytime."

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
Will looked up from his phone, exasperated. "Nico, I don't know why you're freaking out. It's just a makeup tutorial. You'll wear some glitter and a silly hat and we'll be done in an hour."

Nico's eyes were wide with panic. "You want me to star in a video, Will. A video that will be on the internet, where people will see me looking like a fool."

Will shrugged. "You'll be a fabulous fool, darling. And it's for a good cause – my YouTube channel needs a boost."

Nico sighed, but eventually relented. As they set up in front of Will's camera, Will's makeup artist, a mischievous-looking demigod named Leo, chattered excitedly about the look he had planned.

"So, Will's going to be a Greek god, but not just any Greek god – a Greek god with a twist. I'm thinking a bit of blue eyeshadow to give him that ' sea-god' vibe, and some strategically-placed glitter to make him shine like the stars."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "You can't be serious."

Leo grinned. "Completely, darling. And to top it off, I've got a special surprise for Will."

Will looked at Nico uncertainly. "What is it, Leo?"

Leo just winked. "You'll see."

As the makeup tutorial progressed, Nico's transformation was indeed dramatic. He was covered in glitter, his hair was styled in a ridiculous pompadour, and he was wearing a toga made out of what looked suspiciously like a garbage bag.

Will, on the other hand, looked stunning. His blue eyeshadow and strategically-placed glitter made him look like a actual sea god, and his hair was perfectly styled.

When the makeup was complete, Leo stepped back to admire his handiwork. "Ta-da!"

Nico looked at Will in horror. "You look like a Greek god. What am I supposed to do?"

Will just grinned. "I'm going to start dancing. Watch this."

Will put on some music and began to dance, his glitter-covered body spinning and twirling across the room. Nico couldn't help but laugh.

As they finished the video and uploaded it to YouTube, Nico turned to Will with a smile. "You know, that was actually kind of fun."

Will grinned back at him. "I told you it would be. And who knows – maybe we'll go viral."

Nico just rolled his eyes. "I wouldn't count on it."

But as they watched the video, Nico couldn't help but laugh at the sight of Will dancing around in his toga, glitter flying everywhere.

"You know, Will," he said, "you're a bit of a diva."

Will just winked at him. "That's why you love me, darling."

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
As Nico navigated the twists and turns of the Labyrinth, his eyes scanning for any sign of the Minotaur or other dangers, he stumbled upon a boy who seemed completely out of place. The boy's freckled skin and messy brown hair stood out starkly against the dim, dusty walls of the maze. He looked about as lost as Nico felt.

"Hey, you okay?" Nico asked, approaching the boy cautiously.

The boy looked up, startled, and Nico was taken aback by the bright, piercing blue of his eyes. "Yeah, I'm fine. I think. I mean, I'm not sure. I'm not even really here."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "Not even really here?"

The boy nodded enthusiastically. "I'm from the future. I'm a time traveler. And you're Nico di Angelo, right?"

Nico's eyes widened in surprise. "How did you know that?"

The boy grinned. "I've studied the ancient Greeks. And I've also studied you. You're kind of a big deal in my time."

Nico felt a shiver run down his spine. "What do you mean?"

The boy's grin grew wider. "I'm your boyfriend, Nico. My name is Ethan. We met in college, and we fell in love. I've come back in time to warn you about something."

Nico's mind reeled as he tried to process this information. A boyfriend from the future? It sounded like something out of a myth or a fairy tale.

"Ethan, I don't know what to say," Nico said, feeling a little overwhelmed.

Ethan took a step closer, his eyes locked on Nico's. "I know this is a lot to take in, but trust me, Nico. We need to talk. The future isn't set in stone, and I've seen things that could change everything. But I need your help to make it happen."

Nico hesitated, unsure of what to do. Part of him wanted to believe Ethan, to think that there was a future where he and this strange, freckled boy were together. But another part of him was skeptical, unsure of what was real and what was just a product of Ethan's imagination.

As they stood there, the Labyrinth seemed to grow darker and more menacing around them. Nico could feel the Minotaur's presence lurking just out of sight, waiting to strike.

"Ethan, I don't know if I can trust you," Nico said finally, his voice barely above a whisper.

Ethan's face fell, but he didn't give up. "I know I'm not from your time, Nico. But I'm telling you the truth. I'm your future. And I need your help to change the course of history."

Nico's heart was racing as he looked at Ethan, trying to see beyond the boy's words to the truth behind them. And as he did, he felt a spark of connection, a sense of recognition that went beyond just a physical attraction.

"Okay, Ethan," Nico said finally, his voice firm. "I'll listen to what you have to say. But if this is some kind of trick, you're going to regret it."

Ethan's face lit up with a radiant smile. "I promise, Nico. I'll never regret this. Not if it means being with you."

As they stepped forward together, the Labyrinth seemed to fade into the background, and all that was left was the two of them, lost in the uncertainty of the future.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
Will stood at the kitchen counter, staring blankly at the stack of clean dishes in front of him. It was 3 AM, and the only sound was the distant hum of the refrigerator and the occasional creak of the old wooden floorboards. He let out a deep sigh and scrubbed a hand through his hair. Nico had been restless all night, and Will knew it was because of the nightmares.

Those memories still lingered, haunting them like ghosts. Will had learned to recognize the signs - the twitching, the sweating, the desperate plea for calm in Nico's voice. It was a pain they both carried, a reminder of the horrors they'd faced in Tartarus. But they'd made it out alive, and that was what mattered.

As he turned to put the dishes away, he noticed Nico standing in the doorway, his eyes fixed on the floor. Will's heart went out to him, and without a word, he crossed the room to pull Nico into a tight hug.

For a long moment, they just stood there, holding each other as the world outside receded. Nico's arms wrapped around Will's waist, and he buried his face in the crook of Will's neck. Will felt the tension in Nico's body begin to ease, his breathing slowing as he let go of some of the fear that still lingered.

And then, without warning, Nico's hips began to move. Will felt it first as a subtle swaying, but then Nico's feet started tapping out a beat on the floor. Will couldn't help but laugh, and before he knew it, he was swaying too, his arms wrapped around Nico's waist as they danced to the rhythm of the night.

It was a crazy, beautiful thing, this dance they shared. They moved in perfect sync, their bodies swaying to the beat as if they'd been doing this for years. Will felt the weight of their past lifting, the fear and the pain melting away as they lost themselves in the music.

As they twirled around the kitchen, the stars twinkling through the window like diamonds, Will felt a sense of freedom wash over him. This was what it meant to be alive - to let go of the past and find joy in the present.

The music was a beat, a rhythm that spoke directly to their souls. It was a language they'd learned in Tartarus, a way of communicating that transcended words. As they danced, Will felt Nico's heart beating in time with his own, their love pulsing like a living thing.

And in that moment, they were free. Free from the nightmares, free from the weight of their past. They were just two people, lost in the music, their love shining like a beacon in the darkness.

As the night wore on, they finally slowed to a stop, their chests heaving with laughter and exertion. Will smiled down at Nico, his eyes shining with happiness.

"You okay?" Will asked, his voice low and gentle.

Nico nodded, his face still buried in Will's neck. "Yeah. I think I am."

Will wrapped his arms around Nico, holding him close as they stood there in the quiet kitchen, the stars twinkling above. They were okay. They were alive, and they were together, and that was all that mattered.
